headline.main: In The Nation; Some Rejected Patterns for the OWM

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 2 -- When the President created the Office of War Mobilization in the form he did, with James E. Byrnes at its head, he chose one from a number of diagrams. Whether his choice was the best from the standpoint of organization will probably never be demonstrated unless this design is unsuccessful and is successfully replaced by one of those that Mr. Roosevelt rejected.
